Prepare count matrices for analysis

Source: R/facades.R
prepare_count_matrices.Rd

Transforms the loaded data into analysis-ready count matrices. This includes filtering, pivoting, deduplication, annotation joining, and artefact removal.

Usage

prepare_count_matrices(
  data,
  annotation = NULL,
  exclude_samples = NULL,
  exclude_targetons = NULL,
  min_counts = 10,
  sample_col = "supplier_name",
  count_col = "COUNT",
  targeton_col = "targeton_id"
)

Arguments

data

An SGEData object from load_sge_data(), or a data frame containing the complete dataset (counts joined with metadata).

annotation

Data frame of variant annotations. If data is an

SGEData object, this is extracted automatically and can be omitted.

exclude_samples

Character vector of sample names to exclude (default: NULL).

exclude_targetons

Character vector of targeton IDs to exclude (default: NULL).

min_counts

Minimum total count threshold (default: 10).

sample_col

Column name for sample identifier (default: "supplier_name").

count_col

Column name for count values (default: "COUNT").

targeton_col

Column name for targeton ID (default: "targeton_id").

Value

A list containing:

annotated_counts

List of annotated count data frames by targeton

normalisation_matrices

List of normalization matrices by targeton

complete_matrices

List of full count matrices by targeton

targeton_ids

Character vector of targeton IDs

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Using SGEData object (recommended)
matrices <- prepare_count_matrices(
  data = sge_data,
  exclude_samples = c("bad_sample_1"),
  min_counts = 10
)

# Using data frames directly
matrices <- prepare_count_matrices(
  data = complete_dataset,
  annotation = annotation_df,
  min_counts = 10
)
} # }
